meanings.definition: 満足させる、満たす、十分な

etymology.value: From the root word 'puas' (satisfied) with the prefix 'me-' and suffix '-kan' to form a causative verb.

inflection.notes: This is an adjective derived from a verb. The verb form is 'memuaskan' (to satisfy).

usage_notes.explanation: 'Memuaskan' is used to describe something that provides satisfaction or fulfills a need or expectation. It can refer to both tangible and intangible things. The degree of satisfaction can vary, so it's often used with adverbs like 'sangat' (very) or 'cukup' (enough).

examples.note: 'Memuaskan' requires an object. 'Dia memuaskan' is incomplete. It needs to be 'Dia memuaskan siapa?' (Who does he/she satisfy?)
'Memuaskan' is the verb. 'Puas' is the adjective meaning 'satisfied'. Use 'puas' to describe your own feeling.

readability_explanation.text: 'Memuaskan' means something makes you happy because it is good enough or meets your needs. It's like when you eat a good meal and you feel 'kenyang' (full) and 'senang' (happy) - the meal is 'memuaskan'. You can also use it when you do a good job and your boss is happy - your work is 'memuaskan'.

example_sentences.sentence: Film ini sangat memuaskan para penonton.
example_sentences.translation: This film is very satisfying to the audience.
The quality of the product is very satisfactory.
